To take into account the geographical space om which the disease spreads, we consider a two-dimensional regular square lattice with N nodes and periodic boundary conditions. In such a grid every node has four nearest neighbors and the disease would spread spatially like a wave front. It is known that, in analogy to the problem of percolation on lattices
27 , for a supercritical infection probability λ > 0.5 a nonzero probability for the spreading of the infection exists
28 .
